items.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
items.summary: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

items.title: Netanyahu and Putin escalate their wars as Trump looks on
items.summary: In the Middle East and in Europe, political leaders are making their own arrangements in the absence of US leadership.

items.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
items.summary: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

items.title: Inside the $8b plan to station American sailors and subs near Perth through AUKUS
items.summary: The head of Australia's submarine agency says planning is so far advanced to settle the American soldiers that quarantine arrangements for their pets are underway.

items.title: What were assassinated right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk's views?
items.summary: Assassinated right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was an icon for young conservatives in the USA and Australia — so what were some of his views that so enraged some people, but energised others?

items.title: Blood moon delights stargazers as total lunar eclipse seen from Australia
items.summary: Stargazers around the world are dazzled by the sight of a "blood moon" — or total lunar eclipse — with the spectacular sight even visible from Australia.

items.title: North West Shelf extension comes at critical juncture in Australia's climate conversation
items.summary: Seven years after it was first mooted, the extension of Australia's biggest gas project could not have landed at a more critical juncture for the nation's climate credentials.

items.title: Greg Norman announces his departure from LIV Golf after four years with the tour
items.summary: Australian golfing great Greg Norman officially calls time on his controversial spell as a key figure in the LIV Golf tour revolution.

items.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
items.summary: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

items.title: Prince Harry arrives in Kyiv to meet with wounded Ukrainian war veterans
items.summary: Prince Harry has travelled by train to Ukraine, for the second time since Russia invaded in early 2022.

items.title: Terry Irving awarded $130,000 for malicious prosecution that led to wrongful imprisonment over 1993 Cairns robbery
items.summary: Terry Irving was initially charged as an accessory for loaning his car to the man responsible for robbing a bank in 1993. But while he was in custody, he was charged with the robbery itself.

items.title: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell ordered to complete community service for intimidating police officer
items.summary: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell has been ordered to serve 200 hours of community service after being found guilty of intimidating a police officer.

items.title: Community farewells Dapto Dogs after 90 years of greyhound racing
items.summary: One of the most famed tracks in Australian greyhound racing, known as the Dapto Dogs, has held its final race meet after almost 90 years.

items.title: Jaime Martín on bringing the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra on tour to the UK and Europe
items.summary: Jaime Martín on how he fell in love with Melbourne, taking the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra home to Santander and championing Australian composers on world stages.

items.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
items.summary: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

items.title: Regulator with oversight of gas leak 'scandal' had paid role with industry lobbyist
items.summary: The man in charge of the Northern Territory government's handling of a major methane leak at a Santos gas plant was working with a lobbyist for the project's co-owner.

items.title: Independent accreditation system for fertility sector to be established as all recommendations of IVF review accepted
items.summary: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler has announced he has accepted all recommendations of a rapid review into the IVF sector at a meeting with state and territory health ministers in Perth.

items.title: 'Clone' websites catch out Australian customers as online shopping scams become 'alarmingly' common
items.summary: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

items.title: Conflict on campus between staff and management as thousands are sacked and courses cut
items.summary: With the university sector in crisis, thousands face losing their jobs as unions blame poor management and students say they've lost hope.

items.title: Australian airlines fare poorly in global ranking of frequent flyer programs
items.summary: Millions of Australians are signed up to airline loyalty schemes, but a new global ranking finds travellers are getting poorer value than from overseas carriers.

items.title: Limestone Coast is a food bowl and forestry powerhouse, but its water supply is under threat
items.summary: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

items.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
items.summary: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

items.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
items.summary: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

items.title: Hawthorn ends Adelaide's season with rollicking semifinal win, setting up epic Geelong prelim final date
items.summary: Hawthorn will face Geelong in a preliminary final after knocking minor premier Adelaide out with a 34-point semifinal victory. Follow live.

items.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
items.summary: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

items.title: Netball Australia, players strike revenue-sharing deal in collective player agreement
items.summary: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

items.title: ASX higher on US rate cut expectations, but markets underestimating inflation risk — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Westpac's economics team, led by former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis, say they think markets are underpricing the risk of a renewed inflation breakout in the US.

items.title: Murdochs resolve succession saga but family's hold on empire is vulnerable
items.summary: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

items.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
items.summary: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

items.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after Gen Z protests prompt political change
items.summary: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

items.title: Elon Musk could receive a $US1 trillion payment package from Tesla. Here's what to know
items.summary: Tesla's board has proposed a $US1 trillion ($1.52 trillion) compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk in what would be the largest corporate pay package in history.

items.title: Disagreement over way forward for Australian National University after Genevieve Bell resigns as vice-chancellor
items.summary: The resignation of Australian National University vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell has sparked furious debate over whether it constitutes enough of a "reset" for the institution after months of controversy.

items.title: PM François Bayrou has lost a confidence vote and France's government has collapsed. What now?
items.summary: A series of challenges sees François Bayrou, who Emmanuel Macron backed to be PM, ousted from office, plunging the country in a deepening political crisis.

items.title: Clive Palmer's human rights complaint referred to Supreme Court amid ongoing legal battles
items.summary: Mr Palmer is facing two counts of fraud and dishonestly using his position as a company director to funnel millions into his party's 2013 election campaign, and in a separate matter, his company is charged with breaching company takeover laws in 2012.

items.title: British YouTube creator Yung Filly to travel home to UK on bail for sexual assault charges
items.summary: British YouTube content creator Yung Filly, who's facing trial in Perth on sex assault charges, is granted permission to travel home to the UK for the first time since he was arrested.

items.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
items.summary: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

items.title: Construction workers are at higher risk of suicide. Here's how to look out for them
items.summary: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

items.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
items.summary: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

items.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
items.summary: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

items.title: Australia on alert to shot-hole borer threat as WA pivots to tree canopy rehabilitation
items.summary: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot-hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

items.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
items.summary: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

items.title: Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia dies of cancer aged 30
items.summary: The family of Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia has paid tribute to the former Opals and WNBL player, describing her as a "shining light" after her death from cancer at the age of 30.

items.title: France could hold snap elections again amid deadlock and calls for Emmanuel Macron's resignation
items.summary: France is stuck in a cycle of political chaos, with no clear end in sight. It has sparked calls for President Emmanuel Macron's resignation and has become so dire that another round of snap legislative elections is considered possible.

items.title: Court hears details of Hakyung Lee's 'descent into madness' before children's deaths
items.summary: Hakyung Lee is accused of murdering her children, eight-year-old Yuna Jo and six-year-old Minu Jo, and leaving their remains in suitcases at a storage facility in Auckland.

items.title: Haven't started on your tax return and feeling overwhelmed?
items.summary: Despite being something most of us tackle every year, lodging a tax return can easily end up at the bottom of your to-do list.

items.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

items.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
items.summary: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

items.title: Muslim groups call for rethink of approach to terrorism ahead of Islamophobia report
items.summary: Community leaders say the government must consider social and legal reforms to address a spike in Islamophobic incidents.

items.title: NRL finals: Melbourne Storm defeat Canterbury Bulldogs 26-18, Stephen Crichton injured
items.summary: Melbourne is through to another NRL preliminary final after a tough 26-18 win over Canterbury, while the Bulldogs are sweating on the fitness of captain Stephen Crichton.

items.title: Scientists hope planting Palau's 'super corals' will save reefs from climate change
items.summary: Palau's corals have emerged unscathed from the world's devastating marine heatwaves. Researchers are breeding and planting them to save reefs from disappearing.

items.title: The simple system I use for composting
items.summary: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

items.title: Tyler Robinson, 22, in custody after manhunt for conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killer
items.summary: The suspect was taken into custody on Thursday night, about 33 hours after the conservative influencer's murder, FBI Director Kash Patel told a press conference.

items.title: South Korean workers return home after ICE raids at US Hyundai factory
items.summary: The workers arrived home to emotional scenes as many consider never returning to the US following the raids which have caused serious tension between the longstanding allies.

items.title: China announces new nature reserve on contested Scarborough Shoal
items.summary: China says its newly announced reserve is about preserving coral, but the Philippines says it is another step towards Bejing tightening its claim on a contested, strategic area of the South China Sea.

items.title: 'Low levels of satisfaction' with healthcare in Canberra for endometriosis, menopause, identified in Women's Health Matters survey
items.summary: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

items.title: New Zealand fugitive Tom Phillips killed in shootout with police after four years on the run
items.summary: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police during a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

items.title: Artists and users boycotting Spotify over AI use and CEO's military tech
items.summary: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

items.title: 'Unconscionable' for Ireland to participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel takes part, says broadcaster
items.summary: Irish national broadcaster RTE has said Ireland will not participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel does, citing the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza.

items.title: Australia to face Belgium in Davis Cup in Sydney with Final 8 spot up for grabs
items.summary: Lleyton Hewitt's Australian Davis Cup team is ready for another fierce battle with old foes Belgium as they chase a spot in this year's Final 8 in Italy.

items.title: NATO announces operation 'Eastern Sentry' in response to Russian drone incursion in Poland
items.summary: NATO announces plans to beef up the defence of Europe's eastern flank two days after Poland shot down Russian drones that had violated its airspace.

items.title: After Charlie Kirk's assassination, a bitter blame game pushes the US towards the precipice
items.summary: In a country with more guns than people, an increasingly violent and threatening public discourse is creating serious dangers.

items.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
items.summary: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

items.title: Nauru's unorthodox money-making schemes are a 'riches to rags to riches' story
items.summary: Experts say Nauru's new deal with Australia to take non-citizens is the latest episode in an unconventional economic story — one featuring phenomenal growth, a mining bust, and a failed musical about a Renaissance genius.

items.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
items.summary: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

items.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
items.summary: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

items.title: Indonesia floods death toll rises as Australian woman thanks her dogs for saving her life
items.summary: Authorities are still cleaning up following the disaster, which hit two islands in the archipelago amid warnings more rain could fall in affected areas in coming days.

items.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
items.summary: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

items.title: Youth leaders in Nepal discuss interim leadership options with the army as two frontrunners emerge
items.summary: After days of deadly violence, protest organisers have met with Nepal's army to try to plot a path forward for the country, which has a deep distrust of democratic politics.

items.title: Pacific Islands Forum sees Australia-China push for regional influence get 'comical'
items.summary: Anthony Albanese begins a long Pacific tour this week ahead of the Pacific Islands Forum meeting in Solomon Islands, as the battle for influence between China and Australia continues to create headlines.

items.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
items.summary: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

items.title: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
items.summary: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

items.title: Australians watched the moment of Charlie Kirk's assassination on social media with no warning
items.summary: Young Australians say they are seeing graphic video of US commentator Charlie Kirk being shot dead pop up in their social media algorithms without warning.

items.title: Quote Quiz: Who said it, Lachlan Murdoch or Succession's Kendall Roy?
items.summary: As Lachlan Murdoch's ascension to the head of the family business is cemented, can you tell his quotes apart from Succession's self-proclaimed "eldest boy", Kendall Roy?

items.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
items.summary: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

items.title: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price accused of working against NT electorate on migration
items.summary: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has spoken repeatedly of the "damaging impacts of mass migration" – but the Northern Territory wants to attract thousands more migrants.

items.title: The Nampijinpa Price saga doesn't bode well for the future of the Liberal party
items.summary: The fracas over Jacinta Nampijinpa Price shows the Liberal party is a seething mass of frustrated ambition, resentment, tribalism and deep ideological division.

items.title: An Ozzy Osbourne tribute, a Mayhem Ball and a Mariah Carey medley delight fans at the 2025 MTV VMAs
items.summary: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

items.title: Murray Watt stamps final approval of Woodside's North West Shelf extension to 2070
items.summary: Australia's biggest gas project, Woodside's North West Shelf, has received final approval to extend operations through until 2070.

items.title: 'Bubble curtain' ready to protect cuttlefish as algal bloom persists in SA
items.summary: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

items.title: Call for button battery redesign after new study reveals horrific injuries and fatalities
items.summary: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.
